data_table.description: Participant ID, race, ethnicity, gender, participant history of malignancy, number of tubes with plasma, detection of nodal involvement, method used for specimens, blood collection time, normal samples, participant procurement age, tumor sample 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, anesthesia time, Case Report Form, ER, HER1, ERBB2, tumor histology, lymph nodes involvement, tumor stage, progesterone receptor, micro metastasis, age at diagnosis, pathologic diagnosis, chemotherapy, lumpectomy, mastectomy, radiation therapy of participants with breast cancer and involved in the "Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium (CPTAC) Proteogenomic Confirmatory Study of Breast, Colon, Lung, and Ovarian Tumors" project.

variable.name: Participant_ID
variable.description: De-Identified subject (participant) ID, from the pre-printed labels that are part of the procurement package provided by the BCR

variable.name: CRF_Name
variable.description: Information collected on Case Report Form (CRF) at |Submission, Baseline, 1 year follow up, 5 year follow up]

variable.name: Participant_Procurement_Age
variable.description: Participant age in months at the time of tissue procurement

variable.name: Participant_Gender
variable.description: Participant gender using the defined categories [Male, Female, Unknown, Unspecified]

variable.name: Participant_Race
variable.description: Participant race using the defined categories. Options = American Indian or Alaska Native; Asian; White; Black or African American; Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander; Not Evaluated; Unknown (Could not be determined or unsure)

variable.name: Participant_Ethnicity
variable.description: Ethnicity using the defined categories [Not Hispanic or Latino; Hispanic or Latino; Not Evaluated; Unknown]

variable.name: Participant_History_Malignancy
variable.description: Indicate whether the participant was, at any time in their life, diagnosed with a malignancy prior to the diagnosis of the specimen submitted for CPTAC. If the participant has had a prior malignancy, an additional form (the Other Malignancy Form) must be completed for each prior malignancy. (If this question cannot be answered because the answer is unknown, the case will be excluded from CPTAC. If the participant has a history of multiple diagnoses of basal or squamous cell skin cancer, complete an OMF for the first diagnosis for each of these types). [No; Yes, Only Non-melanomatous Skin Cancer Within the Last Year; Yes, Only In Situ Cervical Cancer Within the Last Year; Yes, Only Non-melanomatous Skin Cancer and In Situ Cervical Cancer Within the Last Year; Yes, History of Other Cancer Greater Than One Year Ago]

variable.name: Participant_History_Chemotherapy
variable.description: Did participant ever received systematic chemotherapy for any previous cancer [Yes; No]

variable.name: Participant_History_Neo-adjuvant_Treatment
variable.description: Did participant received therapy for this cancer prior to sample procurement of the tumor submitted for CPTAC. If the participant did receive treatment for this cancer prior to procurement, the TSS should contact the BCR for further instructions.(Note: Systemic treatment and certain localized therapies (those administered to the same site as the CPTAC submitted tissue) given prior to procurement of the sample submitted for CPTAC are exclusionary). [Yes; No]

variable.name: Participant_History_Radiation_Therapy
variable.description: Indicate whether the participant ever received radiation therapy involving the breast [Yes; No]

variable.name: Participant_History_Lumpectomy_Mastectomy_or_Port_Placement
variable.description: Indicate whether this participant underwent lumpectomy/mastectomy or port placement [Lumpectomy/Mastectomy; Port Placement]

variable.name: Aliquots_Plasma
variable.description: Number of tubes of plasma obtained from the participant

variable.name: Blood_Collection_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time on the day of when the CPTAC blood sample(s) was/were collected from the participant.

variable.name: Blood_Collection_Method
variable.description: Method for obtaining the blood sample [Venipuncture (Vacutainer Apparatus); Venipuncture (Syringe); Venipuncture (Syringe); IV Catheter ]

variable.name: Anesthesia_Time
variable.description: Time when anesthesia was administered to the participant.

variable.name: Tissue_Sampling_Method
variable.description: Indicate whether the tissue was obtained via coring or via surgical excision [Coring; Excision]

variable.name: Biopsy_Device
variable.description: Provide the type of biopsy device used (e.g., 10g Bard biopsy device)

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_Number
variable.description: Number of tumor excisional segments or cores obtained

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_1_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when tumor segment 1 was excised

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_1_Weight
variable.description: Weight of tumor segment in mg

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_1_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the tumor excisional segment or core

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_1_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when tumor segment 1 was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_1_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical excision time

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_2_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when tumor segment 2 was excised

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_2_Weight
variable.description: Weight of tumor segment in mg

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_2_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the tumor excisional segment or core

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_2_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the tumor segment 2 was immersed in LN2 vapor.

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_2_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and Surgical excision time

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_3_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when tumor segment 3 was excised

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_3_Weight
variable.description: Weight of tumor segment in mg

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_3_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the tumor excisional segment or core

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_3_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the tumor sample or portion was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_3_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and Surgical excision time

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_4_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when tumor segment 4 was excised

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_4_Weight
variable.description: Weight of tumor segment in mg

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_4_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the tumor excisional segment or core

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_4_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the tumor sample or portion was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_4_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical excision time

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_5_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when tumor segment 5 was excised

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_5_Weight
variable.description: Weight of tumor segment in mg

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_5_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the tumor excisional segment or core

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_5_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the tumor sample or portion was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Tumor_Sample_5_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical excision time

variable.name: Normal_Sample_Number
variable.description: Specify the number of normal segments that were removed and saved to the CPTAC-provided cryomolds

variable.name: Normal_Sample_1_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when normal segment 1 was excised

variable.name: Normal_Sample_1_Weight
variable.description: Weight of normal segment in mg

variable.name: Normal_Sample_1_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the normal segment or core

variable.name: Normal_Sample_1_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the normal segment was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Normal_Sample_1_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical excision time

variable.name: Normal_Sample_2_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when normal segment 2 was excised

variable.name: Normal_Sample_2_Weight
variable.description: Weight of normal segment in mg

variable.name: Normal_Sample_2_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the normal segment or core

variable.name: Normal_Sample_2_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the normal segment was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Normal_Sample_2_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical excision time

variable.name: Normal_Sample_3_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when normal segment was excised

variable.name: Normal_Sample_3_Weight
variable.description: Weight of normal segment in mg

variable.name: Normal_Sample_3_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the normal segment or core

variable.name: Normal_Sample_3_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the normal segment was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Normal_Sample_3_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical devascularization time

variable.name: Normal_Sample_4_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when normal tissue sample was devascularized

variable.name: Normal_Sample_4_Weight
variable.description: Weight of normal segment in mg

variable.name: Normal_Sample_4_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the normal segment or core

variable.name: Normal_Sample_4_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the normal segment was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Normal_Sample_4_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical devascularization time

variable.name: Normal_Sample_5_Excision_Time
variable.description: The 24-hr clock time when normal tissue sample was devascularized

variable.name: Normal_Sample_5_Weight
variable.description: Weight of normal segment in mg

variable.name: Normal_Sample_5_Comments
variable.description: Comments regarding the gross appearance of the normal segment or core

variable.name: Normal_Sample_5_LN2_Time
variable.description: The 24-hour clock time when the normal segment was immersed in LN2 vapor

variable.name: Normal_Sample_5_Ischemia_Time
variable.description: Calculated ischemia time. The difference between time of immersion in LN2 and surgical devascularization time

variable.name: Histological_Subtype
variable.description: Using the participant pathology/laboratory report, select the histology and/or subtype of the tumor submitted for CPTAC. (Note: All other subtypes not listed are excluded from this study.) [Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma; Infiltrating Lobular Carcinoma; Infiltrating Carcinoma NOS; Mucinous Carcinoma; Medullary Carcinoma; Mixed Histology, specify; Other, specify]

variable.name: Histological_Subtype_Mixed_or_Other
variable.description: Specify mixed histology or other histological subtype

variable.name: Initial_Diagnosis_Age_Months
variable.description: Provide the age of the participant in months, at the time the participant was initially pathologically diagnosed

variable.name: Method_of_Pathologic_Diagnosis
variable.description: Provide the procedure used to initially diagnose the participant [Excisional Biopsy; Incisional Biopsy; Tumor resection]

variable.name: Method_of_Pathologic_Diagnosis_Other
variable.description: If the procedure used to initially diagnose the participant was not included in the list provided, please describe the method used

variable.name: Axillary_Staging_Method
variable.description: Using the pathology/laboratory report, provide the axillary staging method used to detect nodal involvement [Sentinel node biopsy alone; Axillary lymph node dissection alone; Sentinel lymph node biopsy plus axillary dissection; No axillary staging; Other (specify)]

variable.name: Axillary_Staging_Method_Other
variable.description: If the axillary staging method used was not included in the list provided, please describe the method used

variable.name: IHC_Staining_Used
variable.description: Indicate whether immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining was performed to detect micro metastasis [Yes; No; Unknown; NA]

variable.name: Lymph_Nodes_Examined
variable.description: Indicate whether any lymph nodes were examined at the time of the primary resection. If the tumor tissue supplied to CPTAC was obtained using vacuum-assisted coring, enter NA and skip the rest of this section. [Yes; No; Unknown; NA]

variable.name: Lymph_Nodes_Examined_Number
variable.description: Provide the number of lymph nodes examined, if one or more lymph nodes were removed

variable.name: Lymph_Nodes_Positive_Hematoxylin_Eosin_Staining_Number
variable.description: Provide the number of lymph nodes positive through hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) staining and light microscopy

variable.name: Lymph_Nodes_Positive_IHC_Keratin_Staining_Number
variable.description: Provide the number of lymph nodes positive through keratin immunohistochemistry (IHC) staining

variable.name: Pathologic_T_Stage
variable.description: Using the participant pathology/laboratory report, select the code for the pathologic T (primary tumor) defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). If the tumor tissue supplied to CPTAC was obtained using vacuum-assisted coring, you may skip this section if appropriate [T0; T1; T1a; T1b; T1c; T1mi; T2; T2a; T2b; T3; T3a; T3b; T4; T4b; T4c; T4d; Tis; TX; Tis (DCIS); Tis (LCIS); Tis (Paget's)]

variable.name: Pathologic_N_Stage
variable.description: Using the participant pathology/laboratory report, select the code for the pathologic N (nodal) defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). [N0; N1; N1a; N1b; N1c; N2; N2a; N2b; N3; N3a; N3b; N3c; NX; N1mi; N1bIV; N1BIII; N1bII; N1bI; N0 (mol+); N0 (mol-); N0 (i+); N0 (i-)]

variable.name: Pathologic_M_Stage
variable.description: Using the participant pathology/laboratory report, select the code for the pathologic M (metastasis) defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). [MX; cM0 (i+); M0; M1]

variable.name: Pathologic_Stage
variable.description: Using the participant pathology/laboratory report, select the stage defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). The patient must be Stage IIA-IIIC to be included in the CPTAC study. [Stage X; Stage 0; Stage I; Stage IA; Stage IB; Stage II; Stage IIA; Stage IIB; Stage IIC; Stage III; Stage IIIA; Stage IIIB; Stage IV; Stage Tis]

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_Status_by_IHC
variable.description: If IHC estrogen receptor testing was performed, provide the result of the test. If this test was not performed, select "not performed", and continue to the progesterone receptor questions. If this test was performed but not available, select "Performed but Not Available" and continue to the progesterone receptor questions. [Positive; Negative; Indeterminate; Borderline; Performed but Not Available; Not performed; Unknown]

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_IHC_Percent_Positive
variable.description: If IHC estrogen receptor testing was performed, provide the percent of estrogen receptor positive by IHC. [<1%; 1-10%; 10-19%; 20-29%; 30-39%; 40-49%; 50-59%; 60-69%; 70-79%; 80-89%; 90-100%]

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Intensity_Scale
variable.description: Using the pathology/laboratory report, indicate the intensity scale used for the estrogen receptor positivity score. [4 Point Scale; 3 Point Scale]

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Score
variable.description: Provide the positivity score using the IHC intensity scale, found on the pathology/laboratory report. [Unknown; 0; 1+; 2+; 3+; 4+; Other (specify)]

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Other_Scale
variable.description: If another scale was used to measure the estrogen receptor positivity, please describe the scale used.

variable.name: Estrogen_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Other_Method_Description
variable.description: If a special method was used to calculate estrogen receptor status (e.g. dextran coated charcoal), describe the method used.

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_Status_by_IHC
variable.description: If IHC progesterone receptor testing was performed, provide the result of the test. If this test was not performed, select "Not Performed," or "Unknown" and continue to the HER2/ERBB2 IHC questions. [Positive; Negative; Indeterminate; Borderline; Performed but Not Available; Not performed; Unknown]

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_IHC_Percent_Positive
variable.description: If IHC progesterone receptor testing was performed, provide the percent of progesterone receptor positive nuclei by IHC. [<1%; 1-10%; 10-19%; 20-29%; 30-39%; 40-49%; 50-59%; 60-69%; 70-79%; 80-89%; 90-100%]

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Intensity_Scale
variable.description: Using the pathology/laboratory report, indicate the intensity scale used for the progesterone receptor positivity score. [4 Point Scale; 3 Point Scale]

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Score
variable.description: Provide the positivity score using the IHC intensity scale, found on the pathology/laboratory report. Only answer this question if PR status is considered positive; if the PR status was negative, continue to the HER2/ERBB2 IHC questions. [Unknown; 0; 1+; 2+; 3+; 4+; Other (specify)]

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Other_Scale
variable.description: If another scale was used to measure the progesterone receptor positivity, please describe the scale used.

variable.name: Progesterone_Receptor_IHC_Positivity_Other_Method_Description
variable.description: If a special method was used (other than IHC) to calculate progesterone receptor status (e.g. dextran coated charcoal), describe the method used.

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_by_IHC
variable.description: If IHC HER2/ERBB2 testing was performed, provide the result of the test. If this test was not performed or unknown, select "Not Performed" or "Unknown", and continue to the HER2/ERBB2 FISH questions. [Positive; Negative; Indeterminate; Borderline; Performed but Not Available; Not performed; Unknown]

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Statusr_IHC_Percent_Positive
variable.description: If IHC HER2/ERBB2 testing was performed, provide the percent of HER2/ERBB2 positive by IHC. If HER2/ERBB2 was negative, continue to the HER2/ERBB2 FISH questions. [<10%; 10-19%; 20-29%; 30-39%; 40-49%; 50-59%; 60-69%; 70-79%; 80-89%; 90-100%; less than 10%]

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_IHC_Positivity_Score
variable.description: Provide the positivity score using the IHC intensity scale, found on the pathology/laboratory report. [Unknown; 0; 1+; 2+; 3+; 4+; Other (specify)]

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_IHC_Positivity_Other_Scale
variable.description: If an additional scale was used to measure HER2/ERBB2 positivity, please describe the scale used.

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_IHC_Positivity_Other_Method_Description
variable.description: If a special method was used to calculate HER2/ERBB2 status, describe the method used.

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_by_FISH
variable.description: If HER2/ERBB2 FISH testing was performed, provide the result of the test. If this test was not performed, select "Not Performed." [Positive; Negative; Indeterminate; Borderline; Performed but Not Available; Not performed; Unknown]

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_FISH_Average_Signals
variable.description: If HER2 copy number testing was performed by FISH, provide the average number of HER2 FISH signals for this participant. If this test was not performed, leave this question blank and move to the next question

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_FISH_Centromere17_Signals
variable.description: If Centromere 17 copy number testing was performed by FISH, provide the average number of Centromere 17 signals for this patient. If this test was not performed, leave this question blank and move to the next question

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_FISH_Centromere17_Cell_Counts
variable.description: Indicate the total number of cells counted by FISH for HER2 & Centromere 17 copy numbers. If these tests were not performed, leave this question blank and move to the next question

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_FISH_Centromere17_Ratio
variable.description: If HER2 copy number and Centromere 17 copy number testing was performed by FISH, provide the ratio of the outcomes of these tests. (For example, if both the HER2 copy number and the Centromere 17 copy number equal 2, the ratio would be 2.2 or 1.0.)

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_FISH_Centromere17_Other_Scale
variable.description: If an additional scale was used to measure HER2 & Centromere 17 positivity, please describe the scale used

variable.name: HER2_ERBB2_Status_Positivity_Other_Method_Description
variable.description: If a special method was used to calculate HER2 & Centromere 17 positivity, describe the method used
